body:
I'm curious what the latest with this issue is. I'm pretty sure we're encountering it and haven't found a good workaround yet, so we'd like to help fix it.

*Background*
We implemented multiplex sandboxing support a few months ago on a Scala rule set for dynamic execution and path mapping benefits. That said, we haven't been able to enable multiplex sandboxing because of flaky build failures. The issues we've encountered include:
* `FileNotFoundException` in JVM workers from the rule set when writing to files in the sandbox
* `IOException while preparing the execution environment of a worker` from Bazel
*  Files 'missing' from the sandbox, presumably because something couldn't write them or something clobbered them.

The issues were inconsistent and hard to reproduce, but common enough to be problematic.

The issues would all go away when we disabled multiplex sandboxing/stopped using dynamic execution for mnemonics that supported multiplex sandboxing.

*Mitigation*
I seem to have mitigated the issue by giving every action its own mnemonic, but that's not a viable solution. I more or less set mnemonic to `mnemonic = "<mnemonic>{}".format(_sanitize_label_for_mnemonic(ctx.label))` for all the mnemonics in the rule set that support multiplex sandboxing. This seems to have consistently stopped the aformentioned issues.

Based on the symptoms and the mitigation, I think we're encountering this issue.

---

I think #23743 is a separate issue having to do with Skymeld, but it was an issue that we found in our search. I want to link it in case anyone stumbles across that issue on their way to this one.
I think I have a fix for this. I'm going to keep testing it and polish it up a bit. If things are still looking good at that point, I'll open a PR for it.

issue.title: Fix race condition with multiplex sandboxed workers

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Prior to this change, multiplex sandboxed workers shared a working directory per mnemonic. This caused a race condition when a new multiplex sandboxed worker with the same mnemonic was launched because when launching it cleaned the working directory. That could cause problems for any actions executing in that directory.

This change makes it so each multiplex sandbox worker process has a unique working directory. It does so while ensuring each SandboxedWorkerProxy and the associated sandbox are still associated with the correct multiplexer process and working directory.

Resolves #22589

I couldn't figure out if the Bazel repo has an autoformatter somewhere, so I did my best to manually format the code with a style that follows the existing code.

issue.title: [8.2.0] Fix race condition with multiplex sandboxed workers

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.2.0 RC3](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.2.0rc3). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.2.0rc3. Thanks!
